panda_ui_controller.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 """
3 Panda UI Controller.
4 Uses 7 sliders to manipulate the position of the panda
5 """
6 import numpy as np
7 
8 from kivy.app import App
9 from kivy.uix.slider import Slider
10 from kivy.uix.gridlayout import GridLayout
11 from kivy.uix.label import Label
12 
13 from hiro_ros_arm_controller.RobotController import PandaController
14 
15 
16 class PandaPositionMover(GridLayout):
17  def __init__(self, **kwargs):
18  super(PandaPositionMover, self).__init__(**kwargs)
19  self.controller = PandaController()
20  # Start from default value in sliders
21  self.desired_positions = [0, 0, 0, -0.0698, 0, 0, 0]
22  # set panda to initial positions
23  self.controller.publish_positions(self.desired_positions, 0.1)
24  self.cols = 3
25  # The limits are from the website:
26  # https://frankaemika.github.io/docs/control_parameters.html
27  self.label_values = []
28  limits = np.array([[-2.8973, 2.8973],
29  [-1.7628, 1.7628],
30  [-2.8973, 2.8973],
31  [-3.0718, -0.0698],
32  [-2.8973, 2.8973],
33  [-0.0175, 3.7525],
34  [-2.8973, 2.8973]])
35  for idx in range(7):
36  joint_name = "Joint {}".format(idx+1)
37  starting_pos = self.desired_positions[idx]
38  slider = Slider(min=float(limits[idx, 0]), max=float(limits[idx, 1]), step=0.001, value=starting_pos, id=joint_name)
39  self.add_widget(Label(text="Panda {}".format(joint_name)))
40  self.add_widget(slider)
41  label = Label(text=str(starting_pos))
42  self.label_values.append(label)
43  self.add_widget(label)
44  slider.bind(value=self.slider_value_change)
45 
46  def slider_value_change(self, instance, joint_value):
47  joint_idx = int(instance.id[-1]) - 1
48  self.label_values[joint_idx].text = str(joint_value)
49  self.desired_positions[joint_idx] = joint_value
50  self.controller.publish_positions(self.desired_positions, 0.1)
51 
52 
53 class PandaSlider(App):
54  def build(self):
55  widgetcontainer = PandaPositionMover()
56  return widgetcontainer
57 
58 
59 if __name__ == "__main__":
60  PandaSlider().run()
